entry.title: First Commit
entry.content:
I don’t know jack about building websites. So I’m using this! The site is hosted by GitHub Pages free of charge. It’s created by jekyll. Put simply, jekyll takes text files and performs magic to turn those boring text files into a beautiful website. Jekyll can take themes, too. My website is using the “Omega” theme by H.M. Faysal. He’s a cool dude. It’s harder to use than a much more common and streamlined blogging content management system, but it also performs faster and has way less security holes. I think if I use this long enough (a month or two?) I should feel right at home!

First Commit was originally published by Chris Bayot at Chris Bayot on May 29, 2014.
